2.title: John Hope - Biography
2.subtitle: John Hope was an important African American educator and race leader of the early twentieth century. In 1906 he became the first Black president of Morehouse College—the alma mater of Martin Luther King Jr.—in Atlanta.

2.title: Vera Institute of Justice
2.subtitle: Vera is powered by hundreds of advocates, researchers, and activists working to transform the criminal legal and immigration systems until they’re fair for all. Founded in 1961 to advocate for alternatives to money bail in New York City, Vera is now a national organization that partners with impacted communities and government leaders for change.

3.title: What Is Juneteenth?
3.subtitle: Juneteenth (short for “June Nineteenth”) marks the day when federal troops arrived in Galveston, Texas in 1865 to take control of the state and ensure that all enslaved people be freed. The troops’ arrival came a full two and a half years after the signing of the Emancipation Proclamation. Juneteenth honors the end to slavery in the United States and is considered the longest-running African American holiday.

3.title: Sade Baron
3.subtitle: Sade and Rachel are a mother-daughter duo creating high-performance body care products that make your skin feel great. As a 100% woman-owned business, they select every ingredient in their products. Everything is handmade, carefully packaged, and personally checked for impeccable quality.

products.name: Body Care Set 1 - Normal Skin
products.description: The essentials kit features everything you need to keep maintain your skin health. Start with a new skinfood routine and feed it nutrient-rich superfoods all day, every day.

products.name: Go Clean Starter Kit | Body Care Set
products.description: With this Go Clean Body Care Starter Set you can finally remove excessive ingredients and chemicals from your daily body care routine. With Sade Baron, all of our products are 100% vegan, made with clean ingredients to work for most skin types, so you can trust that you'll find great products to work for you.

products.name: Fragrance Free Body Wash
products.description: A light face and body wash suitable for everyday use. This fragrance-free body wash is perfect for babies, children and adults with reactive and sensitive skin. With superfats galore like avocado oil, olive oil and more, this liquid castile soap will leave your skin hydrated day after day.

4.title: Lizzie's All Natural Products
4.subtitle: Here at Lizzie's All-natural Products, we create fresh, natural, toxin free products for your home and body. Our promise is to provide you with quality products that your skin will love and benefit from.

products.name: Eczema Butter & Oatmeal Soap Bundle

products.name: Essential Oil
products.description: All of our essential oils are pure therapeutic grade and offer various health benefits.

4.title: Black on Black
4.subtitle: Black On Black™ is beautifully designed clothing & accessories that are both clothing line AND protest sign. Black On Black™ is a social protest on clothing that De:Constructs the Construct.

products.name: "Anti-Racist Social Club" Throw Pillows
products.description: These cozy throw pillows feature high-quality fabric and prints that will upgrade your space. Zippered cover care instructions: machine wash in cold water using mild detergent and gentle cycle only, hang to dry.

products.name: "Juneteenth" - Unisex T
products.description: Juneteenth is the oldest known celebration commemorating the ending of slavery in the United States.  Dating back to 1865, it was on June 19th that the Union soldiers, led by Major General Gordon Granger, landed at Galveston, Texas with news that the war had ended and that the enslaved were now free.

products.name: "Energy I Be On AKA Black Powered" - Unisex Long-Sleeved T
products.description: "Black Powered" T-Shirt - When I think about the greatness of us and all that we've been able to become DESPITE all that we've been through and STILL going through, one reason that is specific to us is, US.

5.title: 1619 Podcast
5.subtitle: An audio series from The Times observing the 400th anniversary of the beginning of American slavery.

5.title: Reconstruction in America
5.subtitle: Read the Equal Justice Initiative's report on racial violence after the Civil War, from 1865-1876.

6.subtitle: Get REAL is a Canadian non-profit that combats LGBTQ+ discrimination and promotes acceptance in schools, summer camps, and workplaces. Our merchandise helps fund our work! Every order is shipped with a piece of feedback written by real students across Canada who have participated in one of our workshops

7.title: Namascents Candle Co
7.subtitle: Namascents Candle Co crafts candles and home fragrance products for any space; welcoming peace, stillness and good thoughts. Our inspiration is nature, love + memories. We keep it clean + simple with a scentful twist.

7.title: Toni Morrison - Biography
7.subtitle: Toni Morrison was a Nobel and Pulitzer Prize-winning American novelist. Among her best-known novels are "The Bluest Eye," "Song of Solomon," "Beloved," and "A Mercy."

8.title: Stay Informed: Ma'Khia Bryant Shooting
8.subtitle: A teenage girl who the police say threatened two girls with a knife was fatally shot by an officer in Columbus, Ohio, on Tuesday, April 20th, 2021, shortly before a jury reached a guilty verdict in the murder trial of the former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin in last year’s killing of George Floyd.

8.title: The Uses of Anger: Women Responding to Racism
8.subtitle: In June 1981, Audre Lorde gave the keynote presentation at the National Women’s Studies Association Conference, Storrs, Connecticut. Her presentation appears here.

9.title: 360 Magazine
9.subtitle:
360 is an edgy fashion, lifestyle and culture magazine. We will introduce cutting-edge brands, entities and trends to tastemakers within their respective communities. Our founding members have over 30 years of collective experience both as notable talent and uber professionals within the realm of fashion, music, art, design and entertainment. We are more than just a magazine comprised of journalists, representing a movement of social awareness and change.

We are a LGBTQIA friendly publication. The magazine is contemporary in look and appeal. Quality art content is the constant goal. The magazine will be entertaining, newsworthy and thought-provoking. It will appeal to a broad entertainment readership. No magazine like it is available today, constantly celebrating racial and sexual ambiguous talent and artists.

9.title: CarmaBella Skincare
9.subtitle: CarmaBella Skincare is made for women who want the best skincare, without any artificial chemicals or unnecessary ingredients. When using our products, you don't have to choose between natural and luxurious.

products.name: Brightening Turmeric Clay Mask
products.description: Want an instant glow? We have the perfect natural skincare product to help you achieve it. The Brightening Turmeric Clay Mask instantly brightens dull, tired skin and restores your skins healthy complexion over time.

products.name: HydroSurge Moisturizing Gel
products.description: The HydroSurge Moisturizing Gel replenishes water and helps to improve your skin's moisture barrier, resulting in smooth, hydrated skin. This addictively refreshing gel leaves skin plump, dewy, and glowing.

products.name: The Essential Bath & Body Set
products.description: The Essential Bath & Body Set is a nourishing collection that will leave your skin feeling soft and moisturized all day. This set includes the Natural Sugar Based Body Wash, a bath puff, and the Nourishing Shea Body Lotion.

10.title: Cultures, nations, and religions are not rocks – they’re always changing
10.subtitle: Learn more about Destiny Instinct. Failing to understand it blinds us to the revolutionary transformations in societies happening all around us.

10.title: Mass Incarceration: Visualized
10.subtitle: Concrete actions, more than stated beliefs, are a true reflection of values, both personal and societal. We may claim to value human life, but our societal actions and policies say otherwise.

11.title: Robert Tanner Freeman - Bytes of History
11.subtitle: Robert Tanner Freeman was born in Washington DC in 1846. He was the son of slaves who had bought their freedom in the 19th century. Historical records are unclear but they probably adopted the surname Freeman in response to their transition.

11.title: Aloha Glamour
11.subtitle:
Aloha Glamour is a lifestyle movement that promotes women loving themselves wholeheartedly. We are a community of women that empower others to use find and use their voice to turn their tragedies into triumphs and their mess into a message which enables them to build from the inside out...seeing and LIVING in color again. 

Thanks to our inspiring collections and our impeccable customer service, we have been highly successful since day one. Browse through our site and check out the latest additions to our collection, and feel free to get in touch with our team if you need any assistance.

We want you to create a story in each and every Aloha Glamour piece that you wear. What's the color of your story?

12.title: Microaggressions Are A Big Deal: How To Talk Them Out And When To Walk Away
12.subtitle: Microaggressions are defined as the everyday, subtle, intentional — and oftentimes unintentional — interactions or behaviors that communicate some sort of bias toward historically marginalized groups. Learn more in this podcast from NPR.

12.title: Yelani
12.subtitle: Yelani products are specifically designed and created for women with naturally curly hair. The product line features chemical free hair care products made from 100% natural ingredients.

products.name: Herbal Beard Oil

products.name: Hand Sanitizer - Rosemary
products.description: Our 8 oz,  liquid hand sanitizer is easily applied with a fine mist spray. It contains 70% alcohol and ships from within the USA.

13.title: Racial Literacy: What Does it Mean?
13.subtitle: What is your first memory of racial difference? Unfortunately, our education system doesn’t include a standard explanation to our young people of the history of the creation of the concept of race (or critical race theory). Learn today what you should've in school.

15.title: Beauty Bakerie
15.subtitle: A single mother and breast cancer survivor, Cashmere Nicole founded Beauty Bakerie in 2011 as a new lipstick brand that was vegan, non-toxic and cruelty-free.

products.name: Chocolate Therapy Sugar Sticks
products.description: A castor oil infused lip liner collection that delivers high-quality custom coverage while lining & defining your lip look. Just add 1/2 cup of sugar and everything will be pretty sweet!

products.name: Eyelash Icing Waterproof Mascara

Blending Eggs will be your new favorite tool for eggs-traordinary cakin' that's hard to beat! Hehe.

15.title: Enough is Enough! Fire the Cops Who Killed Daunte Wright
15.subtitle: Here’s what we know: Police officers in Brooklyn Center, a Minneapolis suburb, shot and killed Daunte Wright during a traffic stop on Sunday, April 11. An unnamed police officer shot a gun into Daunte’s car, and his car then hit another vehicle. A passenger in Daunte’s care was injured, and Daunte was pronounced dead at the scene.

16.title: #ChooseToChallenge - International Women's Day
16.subtitle: A challenged world is an alert world. Individually, we're all responsible for our own thoughts and actions - all day, every day. We can all choose to challenge and call out gender bias and inequality. We can all choose to seek out and celebrate women's achievements. Collectively, we can all help create an inclusive world. From challenge comes change, so let's all choose to challenge.

16.title: Alaffia
16.subtitle:
Alaffia is an online Fair Trading company that specializes in soaps and beauty products. We aim to alleviate poverty and advance gender equality through the Fair Trade of indegenious resources and community empowerment projects.

Together, we’re cultivating beauty, equality and empowerment in West Africa and around the globe. Our women’s cooperatives in West Africa handcraft indigenous raw ingredients then the Alaffia team in Olympia, Washington creates the finished products. Alaffia returns the proceeds from the sale of these products to our communities to fund community empowerment and gender equality projects.

17.title: Grace & Styles Boutique
17.subtitle: Grace & Styles Boutique is a provider of quality leather handbags and must-have accessories.  We provide a variety of colors and trendy styles at affordable prices to suite everyone!

products.name: Clear handbag in blue and black

17.subtitle: Watch Oprah Winfrey's 2018 Golden Globe Awards acceptance speech for the Cecil B. DeMille Award.

18.title: Jackie Robinson's Effect on the Negro Leagues & MLB | 'Field of Dreams...Deferred'
18.subtitle: Things actually got tougher for Black baseball players after Jackie Robinson broke the color barrier, as MLB teams followed racist quotas and the Negro Leagues died out. "Many talented Black players got phased out."

18.title: Doe Wiz Apparel
18.subtitle: Doe Wiz apparel was found by Kamar Doe Wiz Lewis. The term Doe came about from the street meaning "Money," and the term "Wiz" short for wisdom. By combining the two terms, we have the name "Doe Wiz" which means "A smart way to get money."

products.name: DWA Cream or White Hoodie
products.description: Casual spot pullover hoodie - loose fit. Choosing this stylish pull over hoodie will add comfort good for exercise, fitness, workout, running, jogging, sportswear etc.

products.name: DWA Grape Purple Yellow Cropped Top Set

products.name: DWA Varsity Set Red
products.description: Snap closure. Contrast sleeves. Knitted collar, cuffs and waistband with stripe details. Press-stud closure. Contrast studs. Hidden ear phone loops.

19.title: Why Many Americans Can’t See The Wealth Gap Between White And Black America
19.subtitle: In the last year and a quarter, the pandemic has served as a stark reminder of just how unequal America still is. But it also hasn’t been a “reminder” for everyone. Black Americans and other Americans of color didn’t have the luxury of forgetting that American society is unequal.

19.title: Register to Vote
19.subtitle: Register to vote to make your voice heard and make sure the people we elect to positions of power have the best interests of every American in mind.

20.title: Implicit Bias — how it effects us and how we push through
20.subtitle: Everyone makes assumptions about people they don’t know. Melanie Funchess will teach us to recognize these assumptions and work toward a common understanding.

20.title: Build for Black Lives
20.subtitle: Are you an anti-racist designer, developer, data scientist, or marketing specialist interested in committing to pro bono projects to work towards reparations and racial justice? Work on one of our available projects.

21.title: Airis Foods
21.subtitle: Airis Foods are hand crafted food products that add flavor and flare to all your cooking and snacking needs. With both the home cook and the commercial chef in mind, owner Airis the Chef combines simple, wholesome ingredients to create BIG FLAVOR profiles.

21.title: Justice for Jacob Blake
21.subtitle: Jacob Blake is a loving father of 6 that deserves proper medical attention and legal representation. The funds raised through this Gofundme will go toward Jacob’s medical bills, family expenses, legal representation, support for his children and therapy costs.

22.title: Justice for Lakeith Smith
22.subtitle: Lakeith Smith, now 20, was charged with the murder of his friend, A’Donte Washington when he was only 15— a crime he did not commit. A'donte died at the hands of a policeman, after the police fired 4 rounds into him - and he currently walks free.

22.title: Let Sha'Carri Run!
22.subtitle: Sign the petition to reinstate Sha'Carri Richardson and allow this world-class athlete to compete in the 100-meter dash! And revisit the outdated rules around marijuana and athletes.

23.title: The Nile List
23.subtitle: Nile is a digital community that connects consumers with Black-owned brands online. Think of Nile as your one-stop-shop for Black brands. All you have to do is think of what you want to buy online and we will show you somebody Black who makes that!

23.title: Daunte's Funeral and future care of Daunte Jr.
23.subtitle: Please donate to give Daunte Wright the proper burial he deserves and to help his son and son's mother Chyna. And if you can't support financially, please send lots of prayers for the family to get through this tragic loss.

24.title: NAACP Legal Defense and Education Fund
24.subtitle: Through litigation, advocacy, and public education, LDF seeks structural changes to expand democracy, eliminate disparities, and achieve racial justice in a society that fulfills the promise of equality for all Americans. LDF also defends the gains and protections won over the past 75 years of civil rights struggle and works to improve the quality and diversity of judicial and executive appointments.

24.title: The Collective PAC
24.subtitle: The Collective is strengthening our democracy by addressing the significant underrepresentation of the Black community in public office. We are fighting for equal representation and protection under the law so it is vital that we have Black candidates run, and Black voices heard.

The Lemon Pepper and Spicy flavors are made with the original flavor being the base of those Sauces. Sienna Sauce has WOWed so many customers, the family based company had to create a subscription program so the Sienna Sauce addicts wouldn’t run out of their favorite sauces.

products.name: Sienna Sauce Variety Pack
products.description: This gourmet sauce has No High Fructose Corn Syrup and is Gluten-Free. It combines the perfect blend of sweet with a hint of tangy serving as a perfect complement to chicken, pork, beef, or seafood that has been fried, smoked, baked, or grilled.

products.name: Sienna Sauce 3 Pack

products.name: Digital Sauce Lovers E-Book

25.title: United Negro College Fund
25.subtitle: UNCF envisions a nation where all Americans have equal access to a college education that prepares them for rich intellectual lives, competitive and fulfilling careers, engaged citizenship and service to our nation.

26.title: Princess Planet
26.subtitle: Princess Planet is a brand of children's entertainment that helps promote characters with diverse hair textures, skin tones, and cultural backgrounds.

products.name: An Octet of Odes – Volume 1
products.description: An Octet of Odes Volume One is a compilation of poems that premiers eight unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun. All of the princesses’ stories are rooted in the realities of geography and history. They all reflect a love of learning and an appreciation for language, diversity, and culture.

products.name: An Octet of Odes – Volume 2
products.description: An Octet of Odes Volume Two is a compilation of poems that premiers eight unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun.

products.name: Princess Planet: Coloring book
products.description: The Princess Planet Coloring Book showcases sixteen unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun. All of the princesses’ stories are rooted in the realities of geography and history. They all reflect a love of learning and an appreciation for language, diversity, and culture.

26.title: Justice For Tony McDade
26.subtitle: Tony McDade was a transgender black man who got killed by police in Tallahassee. Sign this petition and encourage others to do so as well to get his name out there.

27.title: 3 ways to speak English
27.subtitle: Jamila Lyiscott is a "tri-tongued orator" in her powerful spoken-word essay "Broken English," she celebrates — and challenges — the three distinct flavors of English she speaks with her friends, in the classroom and with her parents. As she explores the complicated history and present-day identity that each language represents, she unpacks what it means to be "articulate."

28.title: End Police Militarization and Over-Policing
28.subtitle: The tragic and unnecessary killings of George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, Tony McDade – and countless Black people at the hands of law enforcement – confirms what we've known for too long: Lawmakers must take serious action to fix the racist policing systems in our country.

28.title: Mike D's BBQ
28.subtitle: Mike D's BBQ is an award winning line of signature BBQ sauces and all-purpose dry rubs. Our sauces are a twist on the traditional BBQ sauce with some unique seasonings and spice levels.

products.name: BIG Sauce Set

products.name: Rub Master Set
products.description: Are you a master with the dry rub? This set allows you to use both award winning rubs on large and small meals like the master you are! This set contains one of each large rub (10.24 ounces)!

products.name: Throw Some D's On It T-Shirt
products.description: Rep your favorite BBQ brand and let everyone know they need to "Throw Some D's On It"

29.title: Cuff

29.title: Soul Cap

30.title: Not all Black people are African American. Here's the difference.
30.subtitle: Black Lives Matter protests have opened up conversations about the history of privilege, racism, and the lived experiences and identities of black people in America. Now, the distinction between "Black" and "African American" has become a prominent conversation on social media.

products.name: Franc Bleu Bow Tie
